defaultSpots.name: Beginner Sailing
defaultSpots.description: This is a great opportunity to learn a great lifetime sport. Instruction will include basic sailing theory and concentrate on boat handling techniques at Keehi Lagoon. Transportation and equipment are provided. Participants must be able to swim.

defaultSpots.name: Beginning Surfing
defaultSpots.description: Learn the water sport of Hawai'i!! This class is for beginners and transportation and equipment are provided. Participants must be able to swim.

defaultSpots.name: Stand-Up Paddling
defaultSpots.description: Learn the basics of Stand-Up Paddling, one of the newest, fastest growing water sports. Participants must be able to swim. Transportation and equipment provided.

defaultSpots.name: Body Boarding
defaultSpots.description: Body Boarding is enjoyed at most beaches in the State of Hawai'i. Come learn the basics of body boarding and water safety at a beach with shore break. Transportation and equipment are provided. Participants must be able to swim. Body boarding is limited to UH students, faculty, staff and their guests.

defaultSpots.name: Beginning Hiking
defaultSpots.description:
Explore the island of Oahu. Join organized hikes to scenic locations.

Transportation provided.

defaultSpots.name: Kayaking Excursions
defaultSpots.description: Excursions are lead to different parts of Oahu and are intended for the beginner kayaker. Learn kayak and water safety skills while experiencing different scenic areas around the island.

defaultSpots.name: Hamilton Library
defaultSpots.description: Hours: 8:00am – 10:00pm

defaultSpots.name: William S Richardson Law Library
defaultSpots.description: Hours: 8:00am – 7:00pm

defaultSpots.name: ATV Raptor Tour
defaultSpots.description: Discover the natural beauty of Kualoa Ranch on a self-drive UTV tour of Ka’a’awa Valley. Following a guide, traverse the lush valley in an open-air 4WD vehicle to check out filming sites from Hollywood movies such as Jurassic Park. $UHM discount 20% off

defaultSpots.name: Oahu Circle Island and Snorkeling Tour
defaultSpots.description: We invite you to join us for a full-day, action-packed tour that will guide you to the finest sights on Oahu, and leave you in total amazement. $UHM discount 20% off

defaultSpots.name: Star Casual Sunset and Show Cruise
defaultSpots.description: Plan your vacation ahead of time by purchasing tickets for this 2-hour cruise from Oahu. Dine on a crab and steak dinner while watching live Hawaiian entertainment, a show called '60 Years of Aloha' and enjoying vistas over the Oahu coast.Read more about Star Casual Sunset and Show Cruise. $UHM discount 15% off

defaultSpots.name: Oahu Submarine Scooter Adventure
defaultSpots.description: Ride a personal, self-propelled, electric underwater scooter through Oahu's underwater world. $UHM discount 10% off

defaultSpots.name: Moanalua Library
defaultSpots.description: Hours: 8:00am – 2:30pm

defaultSpots.name: Salt Lake-Moanalua Public Library
defaultSpots.description: Hours: 8:00am – 4:00pm

defaultSpots.name: Kalihi-Pālama Public Library
defaultSpots.description: Hours: 8:00am – 5:00pm

defaultSpots.name: Honolulu Community College Library
defaultSpots.description: Hours: 9:00am – 3:00pm

defaultSpots.name: Liliha Public Library
defaultSpots.description: Hours: 9:00am – 4:00pm

defaultSpots.name: Aiea Public Library
defaultSpots.description: Hours: 9:00am – 4:00pm

defaultSpots.name: Keehi Lagoon Beach
defaultSpots.description: Keehi Lagoon Beach is a great place for canoeing and boating since the waters are usually calm in the protected lagoon. Provide free lesson to UHM students

defaultSpots.name: Ala Moana Beach
defaultSpots.description: Good beach to see the sunset in a very chill environment on this side of the island.

defaultSpots.name: Kai Beach
defaultSpots.description: Kai Beach is displayed on the Pearl Harbor USGS topo map quad. UHM student who is interested in visiting Kai Beach can print the free topographic map and other maps using the link above. Login hawaii.edu emails.

defaultSpots.name: Makapuu Lighthouse Trail
defaultSpots.description: Further along Kalanianaole Highway is the Makapuu Lighthouse hiking trail. This easy route with its moderate incline to the 647-ft.

defaultSpots.name: Koko Crater Railway Trail
defaultSpots.description: Depending on your speed, the Koko Head trail can take anywhere from 15 minutes running, to a slower climb of 90 minutes to hike to the top

defaultSpots.name: Kapiʻolani Community College Library
defaultSpots.description: Needs UHM student to enter

defaultSpots.name: Āina Haina Public Library
defaultSpots.description: “Swimming with dolphins” is on a thousand bucket lists, but Dolphin Quest Oahu lets you turn your dreams into a slippery, rubbery reality.

defaultSpots.name: Polynesian Cultural Center
defaultSpots.description: The Polynesian Cultural Center is a living theme park where you can find everything from hula dancing to spear throwing.

defaultSpots.name: Shark’s Cove
defaultSpots.description: If you want to strap on an oxygen tank and explore the coral for yourself, Shark’s Cove is the place to go.

defaultSpots.name: Dolphin Quest Oahu
defaultSpots.description: “Swimming with dolphins” is on a thousand bucket lists, but Dolphin Quest Oahu lets you turn your dreams into a slippery, rubbery reality.

defaultSpots.name: Manoa Falls
defaultSpots.description: Nestled in the heart of a tropical rainforest, Manoa Falls is a 150-foot waterfall that empties into a shimmering rock pool.

defaultSpots.name: Honolulu Zoo
defaultSpots.description: Home to more than 900 species, the Honolulu Zoo showcases a variety of rare and exotic animals.

defaultSpots.name: Pearl Harbor
defaultSpots.description: There’s a sober shadow amidst the glittering beaches and resorts of Honolulu, and that shadow is named Pearl Harbor.

defaultSpots.name: Mānoa Falls Trail
defaultSpots.description: Manoa Falls trail is a beautiful and easy hiking trail located in the Honolulu area of the Hawaiian island of Oahu.

defaultSpots.name: Tantalus Arboretum Trailhead
defaultSpots.description: The Tantalus-Arboretum Trail is a short, 0.25 mile long loop trail in the Honolulu area of O'ahu.

defaultSpots.name: Pu'u Ohia Trail
defaultSpots.description: Explore this 3.2-mile out-and-back trail near Honolulu, Oahu.

defaultSpots.name: Nahuina Trail
defaultSpots.address: Na Ala Hele: Nahuina Trail, Honolulu, HI 96822
defaultSpots.description: Nature at its best, wear good shoes/boots make sure phone is charged and someone knows where u going. Enjoy the hike.

defaultSpots.name: Ualakaʻa Trail
defaultSpots.description: Enjoy this 2.3-mile loop trail near Honolulu, Oahu. Generally considered an easy route, it takes an average of 1 h 7 min to complete.

defaultSpots.name: Nā Ala Hele Trail
defaultSpots.description: It is a high-elevation hike through one of Hawaii's largest dry forest areas.

defaultSpots.name: Makiki Valley Trail
defaultSpots.address: Na Ala Hele: Makiki Valley Trail, Honolulu, HI 96822
defaultSpots.description: Great loop trail, accessible in a few places and not too difficult. Very beautiful forest hike without a major attraction but still great.

defaultSpots.name: Queens Beach
defaultSpots.description: Queen's Beach is just east of Waikiki Beach but much more quiet and relaxing. It can get so crowded on Waikiki Beach with all of the hotels and restaurants in the area.

defaultSpots.name: Oneʻula Beach Park
defaultSpots.description: Beautiful beach and park. Plenty of parking, good waves. Great for jsut hanging out, surfing, shore fishing and even bbq

defaultSpots.name: Kuhio Beach Park
defaultSpots.description: This highly popular beach is nicknamed “Kuhio Ponds” because the beach is divided by two concrete walls that stretch 40 years into the ocean.

defaultSpots.name: Temple Beach Park
defaultSpots.description: Temple Beach A low key beach located in Laie near the Laie Temple. This beach is walking distance for most vacation rentals in Laie.

defaultSpots.name: Kawela Beach
defaultSpots.description: kawela Bay (view panorama) is one of the most secluded beaches on Oahu. Located near the Turtle Bay Resort on the island's North Shore.

defaultSpots.name: Āweoweo Beach Park
defaultSpots.description: Awesome little beach, with an amazing basketball court, jungle gym, plenty of grass, and plenty of beach!

defaultSpots.name: Mākua Beach
defaultSpots.description: Quiet beach located on Oahu's leeward (west) coast, far away from crowds · Beautiful white-sand beach, but can be hot and dry.

defaultSpots.name: Makao Beach
defaultSpots.description: Makao Beach is located in Hauula on the northern side of Oahu's east coast. This beach isn't visited by many people so don't expect to see any crowds over

defaultSpots.name: Jackass Ginger Trail head
defaultSpots.description: Jackass Ginger Pool is a small, charming-looking 10-foot (3 m) waterfall in the Honolulu neighborhood of Nu'uanu.

defaultSpots.name: Kaihalulu Beach
defaultSpots.description: Kaihalulu Beach is located east of the Turtle Bay Resort on Oahu's North Shore. The beach is backed by a small forest.

defaultSpots.name: Hanaka‘ilio Beach
defaultSpots.description: On the north shore of Oahu lies Hanakailio Beach, a furbulous large beach with white sand where you and your fur-buddy can throw down a blanket and relax

defaultSpots.name: Waimea Valley
defaultSpots.description: This place is absolutely gorgeous, there is about 0.8 miles paved path up to a waterfall where one can swim.

defaultSpots.name: Uppers Beach Park
defaultSpots.description: Uppers Beach Park, 2021. Not to far from the road and a small hike down from where you park
